result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael D. McDaniel was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes: Same repayment conditions as noted in Count 1.

records.addlTxt: Case called @ 9:49 a.m. Defendant Michael D. McDaniel in court with attorney Jeanne Lila Zamzow.  Defendant Michael D. McDaniel in custody.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant advised of potential punishment.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed. Upon motion of the State the Court amends Ct 1 to Misdemeanor Battery contrary to Wis Stat 940.19(1). Plea: Cts 1 & 2 - NC.  Court accepts plea and enters JOC. Statement by DE. Court orders: 9 mos WC Jail as to each count consecutive - Huber, GT, Ct 1 - 203 days CFTS, Ct 2 - 114 days CFTS, Costs w/ 60 DTP or PP. Appeal rights given.
Plea/sentencing hearing on November 1, 2016 at 09:45 am.
from Atty Zamzow requesting the case be removed from the trial calendar and the FTP be changed to a plea/sentencing hearing - the Court will allow the FPTC to be used as a P/S
Jury trial on November 30, 2016 at 08:00 am.
Motion hearing on November 1, 2016 at 09:45 am.

11:40 am case called. Defendant Michael D. McDaniel in court with attorney Jeanne Lila Zamzow.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court goes over standard motions and jury instructions provided to the court. Court addresses motion of the State -Attorney Zamzow states her client will stipulate to the convictions as stated by State. Court admonishes the defendant regarding convictions and if he were to testify what his answer will be (5) and if not answered truthfully the State could permit further evidence of nature of the prior convictions. DA Blader addresses further motions to be addressed. Court adresses status of this trial and motion that needs to be addressed. Court addresses other acts and suppression motion to be filed by October 15, 2016  Motion hearing scheduled for November 1, 2016 at 09:45 am.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: Case called @ 1:20 p.m. Defendant Michael D. McDaniel in court with attorney Jeanne Lila Zamzow.  Defendant Michael D. McDaniel in custody.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived. The court entertains waiver of the time limits for the preliminary hearing. The court accepts voluntary waiver of the time limits for the preliminary hearing.  STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.  Status conference scheduled for January 26, 2016 at 09:30 am.
Initial appearance at 01-05-2016 01:15 pm

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.   Not to be in the possession of any controlled substances without a valid prescription as to the medication and proper quantity. Defendant is prohibited from being in possession of any dangerous weapons.
Defendant and Atty Szilagyi appear via video from WC Jail.

Case called @ 1:04 p.m. Defendant Michael D. McDaniel in court, in custody, appears via video with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel. DE will be represented by SPD. DA Blader requesting $3000 Cash Bond. Statement by Atty Szilagyi. Court orders $3000 Cash Bond.  IA Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.  Initial appearance scheduled for January 5, 2016 at 01:15 pm.
